preqs: It is recommended that students will have successfully completed either VCE Mathematical Methods 1/2 or VCE Further Mathematics 3/4 or equivalent. Students without one of these may need to undertake additional private study beyond the normal workload requirements.

rules.ruleString: (Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ENG1005, ENG1090, ENG1091, MAT1049, MAT1055, MAT1085, MTH1020, MTH1030, MTH1035, MTH1040, MTH1049, MTH1055, MTH1085} and  Incompatible with course version in {0023, 0024, 0169, 0170, 0179, 0181, 0542, 0546, 1185, 1319, 1469, 2015, 2026, 2630, 3830, 4097, 4403, 4410, 4417, 4419, 4425, 4428, 4430, 4635, 4641, 4645, 4649, B2016, B2023} with course status in {ENROLLED, INACTIVE, INTERMIT})

proh: ENG1005, ENG1090, ENG1091, MTH1049, MTH1020, MTH1030, MTH1035 and MTH1040. Note that MTH1010 can only be completed prior to MTH1020 and MTH1030/MTH1035 or equivalent. Students who have achieved a study score of at least 25 in VCE Mathematical Methods units 3/4 (or equivalent) are not permitted to enrol in MTH1010.
description: Functions, domain and range, function representation; different types of functions including linear, exponential, logarithmic, trigonometric, polynomial and rational functions; function algebra; composition of functions; inverse of functions; transformations; modelling with functions; rates of change; introduction to differentiation and integration, including techniques and applications.
